title: Lovisa's same-store sales return to growth
text:
Jewellery retailer Lovisa has flagged another year of heavy investment as it builds the infrastructure needed to support a network of more than 400 stores in 15 countries amid tight consumer spending.

Lovisa opened a net 64 new stores in 2019, including 24 in the UK and Europe, and 18 in the US, and plans to open even more this year while ramping up its fledgling online business, chief executive Shane Fallscheer told shareholders at the annual meeting on Tuesday.

Lovisa CEO Shane Fallscheer says a weaker Australian dollar will affect costs in 2020. Anu Kumar

Lovisa has opened a net 31 stores since the end of June, or two every week, taking the number of stores to 421, 61 per cent of which are outside Australia.

Same-store sales rose 2.3 per cent in the first 17 weeks of the new year, after falling 0.9 per cent in the same period last year, but are below Lovisa's 3 per cent to 5 per cent target range and growth has slowed since August.

Rapid expansion took a toll on earnings growth in 2019 - net profits rose only 3 per cent to $37 million despite a 15.3 per cent rise in sales to $250 million and same-store sales falling 0.5 per cent.
description: The budget jewellery chain plans to open more than 60 stores this year, augmenting stronger same-store sales growth.
